skill.name: skill-installer
skill.description: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos).
skill.summary: Install and manage Codex skills from curated lists and GitHub repositories
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill provides legitimate package management functionality for installing Codex skills from GitHub repositories. The static analyzer detected numerous false positives from JSON content. Network access and filesystem operations are appropriate for a skill installer. The skill references helper scripts that are not present in the directory, which may cause runtime errors but does not pose a security threat.

low_findings.title: Missing Helper Scripts
low_findings.description: The SKILL.md documentation references Python helper scripts in a scripts directory that are not present in the skill directory. This will cause runtime errors when the skill attempts to execute these scripts but does not pose a security threat.

low_findings.title: GitHub Token Environment Variable Access
low_findings.description: The skill documentation mentions accessing GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN environment variables for private repository authentication. This is legitimate functionality for accessing private GitHub repositories but users should be aware of credential usage.

content.user_title: Install and Manage Codex Skills from GitHub Repositories
content.value_statement: Managing and installing Codex skills manually can be time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates the installation process, allowing you to browse curated skill collections and install skills directly from GitHub repositories with a simple command.
actual_capabilities: List curated skills from the openai/skills repository with installation status
Install skills from curated collections with automatic directory setup
Download and install skills from any public GitHub repository path
Access private GitHub repositories using existing git credentials or tokens
Support multiple installation methods including direct download and git sparse checkout
Install multiple skills in a single operation
limitations: Referenced helper scripts are not included in the skill directory and may cause errors
Requires network connectivity to access GitHub repositories
Cannot install skills if destination directory already exists
Requires Codex restart after installation to recognize new skills

use_cases.title: Browse and Install Curated Skills
use_cases.description: Developers can quickly explore the curated skill collection and install recommended skills to enhance their Codex environment without manual file management.

use_cases.title: Install Custom Skills from Private Repositories
use_cases.description: Teams can distribute and install proprietary skills from private GitHub repositories using existing authentication credentials.

use_cases.title: Batch Install Development Toolchains
use_cases.description: DevOps engineers can automate the setup of multiple related skills in a single operation to standardize development environments.

prompt_templates.title: List Available Skills
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me what skills are available to install
prompt_templates.scenario: Discovering new skills from the curated collection

prompt_templates.title: Install Specific Curated Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the error-resolver skill from the curated list
prompt_templates.scenario: Installing a specific skill by name from the curated repository

prompt_templates.title: Install from Custom GitHub Path
prompt_templates.scenario: Installing a skill from a specific GitHub repository URL

prompt_templates.title: Install Multiple Skills at Once
prompt_templates.prompt: Install the commit skill and the file-organizer skill from the curated list
prompt_templates.scenario: Batch installation of multiple skills to set up a complete workflow

output_examples.input: Show me what skills are available to install
output_examples.output:
Skills from openai/skills:
1. error-resolver
2. commit (already installed)
3. file-organizer
4. notion-knowledge-capture
5. skill-creator

Which ones would you like installed?

Successfully installed error-resolver to ~/.codex/skills/error-resolver

Restart Codex to pick up new skills.

Downloading skill from myorg/tools...
Installed custom-analyzer to ~/.codex/skills/custom-analyzer

Restart Codex to pick up new skills.

best_practices: Review the skill documentation and source code before installing from untrusted repositories
Use curated skills from the official collection when possible for better security and compatibility
Restart Codex after installing new skills to ensure they are properly loaded and available
anti_patterns: Installing skills without checking if they already exist in the destination directory
Attempting to use installed skills immediately without restarting Codex
Installing skills from unknown repositories without reviewing their source code first

faq.question: What happens if I try to install a skill that already exists?
faq.answer: The installation will abort to prevent overwriting existing skills. You must manually remove the existing skill directory first if you want to reinstall or update it.

faq.question: Can I install skills from private GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports private repositories using your existing git credentials or by providing a GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN environment variable for authentication.

faq.question: Do I need to restart Codex after installing a skill?
faq.answer: Yes, you must restart Codex after installing new skills for them to be recognized and available for use.

faq.question: Where are skills installed by default?
faq.answer: Skills are installed to the CODEX_HOME directory, which defaults to ~/.codex/skills unless you specify a different destination path.

faq.question: What installation methods are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports direct download for public repositories and git sparse checkout as a fallback. It automatically selects the appropriate method or you can specify it manually.

faq.question: Can I install multiple skills at once?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify multiple skill paths in a single installation command to install several skills in one operation.
